summary: Axis network cameras allow remote code execution due to insufficient sanitisation of the action parameter.
Axis Camera Station and device firmware vulnerable to directory traversal allowing arbitrary file read.
Axis 206/207 series cameras have default credentials that permit administrative access over HTTP.
Hikvision cameras and NVRs suffer from a command injection vulnerability in the web server component.
Hikvision devices expose backdoor credentials allowing unauthenticated remote access.
Dahua cameras allow remote command execution via crafted ONVIF requests.
Ubiquiti UniFi Video cameras vulnerable to authentication bypass on the management API.
Ubiquiti Edge devices allow remote code execution through crafted HTTP requests.
Reolink IP cameras allow authentication bypass via predictable session tokens.
Amcrest cameras expose telnet interface with hardcoded credentials allowing root access.
Multiple Dahua OEM products allow remote command execution due to improper authentication.
Hanwha Techwin Wisenet devices allow stack-based buffer overflow via crafted HTTP request.
Grandstream cameras contain hidden telnet backdoor credentials enabling full compromise.
Vivotek cameras allow remote command injection through crafted CGI parameters.
Vivotek firmware permits credential disclosure via predictable session tokens.
Uniview devices vulnerable to authentication bypass in web management interface.
Uniview NVR allows remote code execution via crafted RPC call.
Lorex and Dahua OEM devices allow authentication bypass and remote command execution.
Foscam cameras vulnerable to stack overflow via RTSP DESCRIBE command.
